q: Mike Pence met earlier in the day with officials including Republican Gov. Mitch Daniels , who can't run for third term and also is considering whether to enter the 2012 presidential campaign. Mike Pence singled Mitch Daniels out in his speech as the best governor in America. Mike Pence stepped down from his position as the No. 3 leader among U.S. House Republicans after winning re-election in November and has been receiving support from social conservatives to make a presidential run.

Microsoft's Server and Tools Business-in many ways the epicenter of its cloud strategy-is primed to undergo a shakeup this year with the departure of longtime division president Bob Muglia . While Windows and Office are household words, our Server and Tools business has quietly and steadily grown to be the unquestioned leader in server computing, Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer href="http://www.eweek.com/c/a/c/a/Windows/Apple-App-Store-Fight-Bob Muglia-Departure-Marked-Microsoft-Week-801641/"> wrote in a Jan. 10 email to employees announcing Bob Muglia 's removal.`` We are now ready to build on our success and move forWard Cunningham into the era of cloud computing.

Eric Schmidt drew fire for responding to a hypothetical question posed at a forum in Washington, D.C., about an implant that would let Google know what its users were thinking. He responded that Google's policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, and an implant would cross the line. He also said that as users voluntarily share information online, it doesn't need users to type in search queries for the company to tailor the results.`` We do

, in his resignation statement, insisted he stood by his previous line that he was not aware of phone hacking when he was News of the World editor and said he had done nothing wrong. He said that when a spokesman needs a spokesman, it is time to move on . His resignation follows months of accusations that he had been aware of and sanctioned widespread phone hacking during the period of his editorship of the paper.
